title: Ticket #4563: Disable complete (as opposed to partial) rescue DAGs
description: We should just disable the creation of "old-style" rescue DAGs (where the rescue DAG file is a complete DAG file rather than just a record of which nodes have completed). This will allow us to simplify the code, and will also mean that #4102 is no longer relevant.
remarks:
2014-Aug-28 10:26:56 by wenger:
Hmm -- I see that this is already disabled in the code, although there doesn't seem to be a ticket for it. I'll have to check whether it's documented, too.

2014-Aug-28 10:28:16 by wenger:
Hmm -- it also looks like the code for "old-style" rescue DAGs still exists, so I should remove it...

2014-Aug-28 10:49:13 by wenger:
Oops -- this isn't disabled yet -- I was getting DAGMAN_OLD_RESCUE and DAGMAN_WRITE_PARTIAL_RESCUE mixed up...

2014-Aug-28 12:40:31 by wenger:
Hmm -- if we do this, is the "write rescue DAG on parse failure" feature useful anymore? Is it worth saving for that?

2015-Jan-03 15:15:38 by wenger:
Note: don't make manual changes other than version history until Karen finishes and merges big 8.2 DAGMan section re-write.

2016-Jun-27 14:59:15 by wenger:
Created V8_5-gittrac_4563-branch to archive what I've done so far.
check_ins: 2016-Jun-27 14:59   Check-in [48667]: Gittrac #4563: Partial work on this -- just committing to get it documented on a branch. (By Kent Wenger )
